qas.question: Who chooses high state officials of Estonia?
Who does the government have to explain their actions to?
What can the Riigikogu monitor for abuse of influence?

context: <a0_0>The Riigikogu<a0_0/> elects and appoints several high officials of the state, including the President of the Republic. In addition to that, the Riigikogu appoints, on the proposal of the President of Estonia, the Chairman of the National Court, the chairman of the board of the Bank of Estonia, the Auditor General, the Legal Chancellor and the Commander-in-Chief of the Defence Forces. A member of <a1_0>the Riigikogu<a1_0/> has the right to demand explanations from the Government of the Republic and its members. This enables the members of the parliament to observe the <a2_0>activities of the executive power<a2_0/> and the above-mentioned high officials of the state.
